com.i2group.apollo.alertretrievalservice

Interface IAlertRetrievalService


  • public interface IAlertRetrievalService
    A method for retrieving Alerts from alert feeds that a user has subscribed to. Clients will poll this interface regularly to retrieve the latest Alerts.
    Since:
    3.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AlertResults retrieveAlerts(AlertRetrievalToken token, List<ItemIdentifier> alertFeedIdentifiers, int maxAlerts, int maxItemsPerAlert)
      Retrieves the Alerts generated by the alert feeds with the specified ItemIdentifiers, in the time since the specified AlertRetrievalToken was created.

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveAlerts

        AlertResults retrieveAlerts(AlertRetrievalToken token,
                            List<ItemIdentifier> alertFeedIdentifiers,
                            int maxAlerts,
                            int maxItemsPerAlert)
                     throws InvalidArgumentException
        Retrieves the Alerts generated by the alert feeds with the specified ItemIdentifiers, in the time since the specified AlertRetrievalToken was created.

        Note: Alerts are not retrieved for alert feeds or Items that the user is not permitted to see, or that have an ItemType that has the ProhibitedRetrieve indicator, or that have been purged from the Analysis Repository. Alerts are also not retrieved for Items that have acted as the source in merge operations.

        Parameters:
        token - An AlertRetrievalToken that was returned from a previous call to this method, or null to retrieve all recent Alerts.

        To re-run a retrieval request, it is permitted to use an old AlertRetrievalToken, provided that the alertFeedIdentifiers are also the same as for the previous request.

        It is not permitted to reuse an old AlertRetrievalToken in a request with different alertFeedIdentifiers. To retrieve Alerts generated by alert feeds with different alertFeedIdentifiers, use a separate (or null) AlertRetrievalToken.

        alertFeedIdentifiers - The ItemIdentifiers of the alert feeds from which to retrieve Alerts, or null to retrieve Alerts from all the alert feeds to which the user is subscribed.
        maxAlerts - The maximum number of Alerts to retrieve, or zero, or a negative number:
        • If the number is positive, a server setting may constrain the actual number of retrieved Alerts still further.
        • If the number is zero, then no Alerts are retrieved, but the AlertRetrievalToken is still updated.
        • If the number is negative, then the number of retrieved Alerts is only constrained by the server.
        If the number of Alerts retrieved is constrained for any reason, the most recent Alerts are retrieved first.
        maxItemsPerAlert - For alert feeds that generate Alerts in response to set membership changes, the number defining the threshold beyond which the server does not include Items for a particular Alert in the AlertResults:
        • If the number is positive, a server setting may constrain the threshold still further.
        • If the number is zero, then the AlertResults contains no Items.
        • If the number is negative, then the threshold is only constrained by the server.
        Note: A low threshold never causes the server to return AlertResults containing a link without its ends.
        Returns:
        AlertResults containing Alerts generated by the specified alert feeds and the Items they refer to, according to the constraints defined by the other parameters.

        Note: The AlertResults contains a new AlertRetrievalToken even when it contains no Alerts.

        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid, or if the TimeZone SOAP header is not provided.
